thread.title: Borussia Dortmund cruise past Wolfsburg despite playing without support of "Yellow Wall"
thread.title_full: Borussia Dortmund cruise past Wolfsburg despite playing without support of "Yellow Wall"

author: Liam Corless
title: Borussia Dortmund cruise past Wolfsburg despite playing without support of "Yellow Wall"
text:
Sport Borussia Dortmund cruise past Wolfsburg despite playing without support of "Yellow Wall" Die Borussen were forced to close their south stand after crowd trouble during a recent match against RB Leipzig Share Borussia Dortmund played in front of a partially empty stadium on Saturday (Photo: GETTY) Share Get football   Thank you for subscribing! Could   
The absence of Borussia Dortmund's famous "Yellow Wall" didn't affect the team as they overcame Wolfsburg 3-0 in the Bundesliga. 
Die Borussen were forced to close their south stand for the match after accepting sanctions from the German FA for crowd trouble during a recent match against RB Leipzig. 
However, the absence of 25,000 Dortmund supporters didn't have any bearing on the outcome of the game as Thomas Tuchel's men cruised to a comfortable victory. 
Full-back Lukasz Piszczek played a key role in the win as he scored one goal and made two others. 
A Jeffrey Bruma own-goal gave Dortmund the lead before Piszczek's strike, and the 31-year-old turned provider when he set up Ousmane Dembele for the third goal. Dortmund's famous "Yellow Wall" wasn't present for the match against Wolfsburg (Photo: Borussia Dortmund) The reduced attendance didn't affect Dortmund (Photo: Borussia Dortmund) Dortmund were 3-0 victors over Wolfsburg in the Bundesliga (Photo: Borussia Dortmund) Lukas Piszczek played a key role in Die Borussen's victory (Photo: Borussia Dortmund) Read More Liverpool open talks to sign Â£20m Mario Gotze from Borussia Dortmund this summer 
Elswehere, Bayern Munich surrendered the chance to go 10 points clear at the top of the table after they were held to a 1-1 draw by Hertha Berlin. 
Carlo Ancelotti's side were trailing to a Vedad Ibisevic's 21st-minute strike up until the sixth minute of injury-time when Robert Lewandowski snatched a point for the German champions. 
Bayern are now unbeaten in 14 matches in all competitions but Leipzig can close the gap at the top of the table to just five points with a win at Borussia Monchengladbach on Sunday. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
